reviews.review: DbD is fun. Looping is toxic tho

I totally recommend this game for anyone who wants to play a "horror game" but don't want to get constantly scared out of their lives. The plot of the game is amazing even with its somewhat large learning curve, when you get over a couple of hours of playtime the game really shines and its amazingly fun with friends.

Dead By Daylight is a very unique experience in the two roles you can play. It's very rough on new players as the objectives are clear, but how you go about handling them while also trying to figure out what your opponent is doing, while also not yet understanding the perks, etc., etc, can be very harsh. It's quite brutal to blindly jump into. But despite that, it's not too tough to get into. As you learn what each killer can do and start to get an idea of what at least most of the common perks and addons do, it becomes a deep and rewarding learning experience. Your playstyle as a survivor is shaped by which killer you are facing, and vise versa, but each match as survivor you go in blind not knowing who you are going to face (unless you play custom games). Many players tend to pick either survivor or killer as their only playstyle of choice, usually because they got the game because they wanted to play one or the other, but I can't stress this enough; you need to play both roles. There's so much to learn and if you only play half the game, you will either never learn everything you need to know, or it will take a long time. And if you refuse to play the other role, everything that you find annoying or unfair about the other will always feel like that. You need to play both sides to understand why people play how they do.

Try out different killers. Try all the weirdest addons you come across. Mess around with all the perks you find as you level up characters. Dive into the lore. Watch streamers or guide videos. Etc. Don't just jump into the game with false expectations, lose a match, then give up. At the very least play a few games on both sides, and if you are confused about anything look up some videos on YouTube. There's a wide selection of very kind players who can point you in the right direction. This game has a very high skill ceiling, but the skill floor isn't too low. You'll improve as you go, and the more killers you face or play as, the better you will do.

This game is asymmetrical; this means the teams are *NOT* equal. It's 4 survivors vs 1 killer. The survivors, to an extent, need to cooperate at least a small amount. If you don't know how to handle helping out teammates or when you should be repairing generators, YouTube and Twitch as well as other platforms have plenty of advise and answers! And remember; most things in this game are fair. Balanced? Arguably, but everything has a counterplay. If something feels unfair or too strong, look it up. Look at the positives of said unfair thing. Look at the drawbacks. Just don't be another "noed op" or "dead hard op" player. Adding false opinions based on your own inability to discover counterplay only adds unwanted and unnecessary toxicity to the community. Remember; play how you want. Use any items or perks you want. Play any killer or survivor you want. Do as you please. If anyone tells you otherwise, ignore them. But remember, those other characters in your game are real people too. You don't have to be obnoxiously nice, but at the very least treat them with some respect. Compliment their gameplay and decisions. Offer feedback, not criticism. Be positive and you'll receive positivity back.

This is an absolutely amazing game, if you give it the time needed to learn. The possibilities are endless and several new killers with unique playstyles are added regularly (There were 3 killers on launch in June of 2016, now in November of 2019 there are 13, and new releases are every few months!). Alongside them are new perks that shake up the meta and new survivors to play as. Cosmetics are definitely pricey, but there are absolutely zero RNG loot boxes / pay to win gambling. Non-licensed DLC Killers and Survivors are also available to purchase via earned currency with enough time between releases to be able to easily afford the newest characters if you play often enough. All maps are free, and not owning a DLC does *NOT* lock you in non-DLC lobbies; you can face every killer and have any survivor on your team, even if you can't actually play as them. DLC only provides access to play as the characters whenever you want.

This game is a great use of 20 bucks. Alternatively get it on sale or via a key dealing website. Either way, this game is worth your time to check out. It's not the best game that exists, but there's a reason many players have several thousand hours, and why I, myself, am building up toward my first thousand.
The best buggy game on the market. It has been great to watch this game and its community grow.
Great fun. Fast paced. Exciting. Good for horror fans. Great online game. Can be frustrating at times but one of my favourite games overall.

[h1] A never-ending blood-splattered carousel of fun I can't get off [/h1]

I had given Dead By Daylight about 2 full seconds of my attention for the first year of its life. I have never been one much for horror movies or even being startled...

I bought Dead By Daylight (DBD) in a pack with another game, Deathgarden. Little did I know I had found one of my favorite and most enjoyable games of my adult life packaged with a terrible piece of garbage game. Little did I know that that amazing game was DBD and that the game I actually wanted out of the bundle would be immediately uninstalled within the week.

The brilliance of DBD is that its not fair. Is asymmetrical, but but not just in its experience and play-styles. DBD is asymmetrical in its difficulty. 

The joy of being a survivor is in the narrow victories, the nail-biting moments, and the cry-out-loud flubs.

The joy of being the killer is in the flawlessly executed strategy, the amazing chance plays, and yes, the power fantasy.

Both share a bit of game-play, they both find their fun in outwitting your opponent(s) and the mind-games at mid to high rank are as mesmerizing as they are sly.

If this wasn't enough to pull you through a multi-hour binge into the wee hours of the morning, the progression and currency systems are for the most part spot on, keeping you pushing harder and harder for your "blood points".


[u] Content [/u]

The content in DBD is not lacking either. Years of DLC has pushed both the survivor and killer sides with endless combinations of perks, items, and offerings. Customizing and strategizing with your load-out helps fill up the downtime between matches and is a game all in itself.


[u] Player-base [/u]

At time of writing the community is alive and well, with wait times measurable in seconds and not minutes. In such a ruthless game there is bound to be toxicity, but this mainly is found in the lower ranks.

Id say the one thing that needs the most rework is its disconnection/surrender system which penalizes all involved when a survivor disconnects a few minutes into the game. Again this is mainly a problem for lower to mid ranks where new/lower rank survivors tend to believe the games unfair asymmetry makes them deserving of leniency and a fitting reason for a "killer code of conduct" to not be "toxic". I only play survivor, and while frustrating at times it is definitely the more rewarding side for me and if you are one of these survivors that winges about such things, I say with love, "git gud scrub. You don't deserve any mercy." 


[u] Conclusion [/u]

In fact the higher the ranks, the more "fair" things become, even siding heavily with the survivors in the wee top tiers. This is part of the fun. Watching the power dynamic shift as you gain skill is one of the most rewarding parts of the game.

Now I am no pro, and my juking skills need tons of work, but transforming from a scared little survivor to a confident, mechanically minded, terrorizer of killers is very satisfying and has kept me coming back even after binging on the game for months.

All in all, its a simple game. We are adults playing a bloody version of hide and seek and in that simplicity its depth becomes apparent. The scrounging nature of man who will find an advantage no matter how small becomes apparent. The uniqueness of a real time battle of wits becomes apparent.

I won't be leaving anytime soon. See you at Coldwind farms. I'll be the one you can never quite catch.

Dead by Daylight is extremely fun. Like every other review says the game is incredibly addicting. That being said. only play this game if you're thick skinned. It has a ridiculous amount of frustrating things in it. Not to mention taht the community will give you shit for things you do on Killer side. Theres not much winning on Killer regardless of actions, you'll get flamed regardless.
